titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. W. A. Harris, Lee Harris, and P. K. Christian, Judgment
CWG10538

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Ky Plff
against } assault & Battery
W A Harris Lee Harris & P K Christian Defts

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendants by their attorneys and thereupon came a jury towit: P G Roby. B L Waller, D Hooser, Sal Wolf, John Lindsay, J W Stovall T J Wilson, Saml McCalpin, Stephen Latham N C Lewis, J C Millen and S P Standard who being sworn well & truly to try the issue joined and having heard the evidence & arguments of the Counsell and being Charged by the court, upon their oaths do say "we of the Jury find the defendants W A Harris & P K Christian guilty of an assault and assess the fine at forty five dollars on each and Lee Harris not guilty as charged in the indictment" B L W --
Wherefore it is considered by the court that the plaintiff recover of each of the defendants W A Harris & P K Christian the sum of forty five dollars & her cost herein expended.

A copy attest
Ben L Perkins C T C C

Todd Cir. Ct
Respite 12 mo
B M
$45. each
W. A Harris & P. K. Christian
Issd. May 11. 1861
